alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 9:17PM CDT until June 19 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall over the past several days has occurred over the Sucarnoochee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River. Another statement will be issued by Friday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...From late Friday night to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to a crest of 19.6 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
